# Password Unlock using IR Remote
### BY Iot Noob
## Introduction
In this tutorial i will show you how you can use an ir remote as keypad to enter a password using Arduino in this i use [SN74HC595N Shift register](https://pdf1.alldatasheet.com/datasheet-pdf/view/27939/TI/SN74HC595N.html) [IR Reciver](https://components101.com/asset/sites/default/files/component_pin/TSOP38238-Pinout.png) [1 chanel relay](data:image/jpeg;base64,)    and arduino uno. as Shift register is optional you can plug jhd LCD pins directly to an arduino uno i use shift register to save pins on arduino as ardinoi am using arduino uno so it contains 13 digital pins and lcd consume almost every pin of my uno but its fine you can use JHD lcd default library or use [Shifted LCD library](https://github.com/iot-Noob/Arduino-Library/tree/main/ShiftedLCD-master) 
## Hardware you need
- Arduino uno or any other arduino base board
- jumper wires
- [SN74HC595N](https://pdf1.alldatasheet.com/datasheet-pdf/view/27939/TI/SN74HC595N.html)   Shift register
- IR Reciver
- [JHD162A](https://www.circuitstoday.com/interfacing-lcd-to-arduino) lcd module
- Bread board
## Download Shifted lcd library
If you use shift register like i did dowload the [Shifterd LCD library](https://github.com/iot-Noob/Arduino-Library/tree/main/ShiftedLCD-master)  Othervise you can modify the code to change few things inorder this code to work
## Schematic
Here is the schematic for circuit you have to build down below.

![Schematics](https://github.com/iot-Noob/Audrino-UNO-/blob/master/IR%20Remote%20Password%20Lock/Schematic%202.png)

## In the end
here are 2 versions i made for this project in first on  i store my values in a datatype which didnt stay forever it is gone when board reset in second version i store those values to EEPROM of arduino so it stay forever and you can change the password as well it will update the password on EEPROM of an arduino enjoy the code.
